alert.note: Alert for Sandoval (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued September 23 at 11:55AM MDT until September 24 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Albuquerque NM has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Puerco Above Guadalupe affecting Sandoval County. .Heavy rainfall over the headwaters of the Rio Puerco basin has resulted in localized flooding in the river near Guadalupe. This flooding will cause a significant rise downstream to the confluence of the Rio San Jose and the confluence of the Rio Grande near Bernardo. However, the rise will not exceed flood stage at Bernardo. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING TO JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record above Guadalupe. * WHERE...Rio Puerco above Guadalupe. * WHEN...From this morning to just after midnight tonight. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The estimated current stage is 15.35 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage this afternoon and continue falling to 5.8 feet Wednesday morning. - Flood stage is 14.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 14.2 feet on 08/12/1952. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (12 pm MDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Mon Rio Puerco Guadalupe 14.0 15.35 unknown 6.3 5.9 5.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued this evening around 700 PM MDT.
